page.title: 10The Vine, Sevenoaks
page.content: The Vine is located near the centre of Sevenoaks at the bottom of the High Street. On the Vine is a cricket ground and clubhouse, War memorial and Rest gardens. The Vine Cricket ground is the oldest in England and was the first to use three stumps and two bails. The Vine is now a private club and is involved in training younger players. On the Vine are the seven oak trees from which Sevenoaks gets its name. The War Memorial stands at the top of St. Botolphs Road. It is the statue of a soldier and represents those people from Sevenoaks who fought and died in the War. The Rest garden is a place where people are able to sit in pleasant surroundings. There are a few flower beds and a fishpond over which there is a man made bridge.
